contentrichtext.text: {{about|the party founded in 1999|the party founded in 1992|Party of Communists of Kyrgyzstan|the party which governed the Kirghiz Soviet Socialist Republic|Communist Party of Kirghizia}} {{Use dmy dates|date=October 2012}} {{Infobox political party |party_name = Communist Party of Kyrgyzstan<br>Коммунистическая Партия Киргизстана |logo = |colorcode = #FF0000 |leader = |chairman = |secretary = Clara Azhibekovna |ppchairman = |foundation = 29 August 1999 |dissolution = |headquarters = Bishkek, Kyrgyzstan |ideology = [[Marxism–Leninism]] |international = [[Communist Party of the Soviet Union (2001)|Communist Party of the Soviet Union]] |colours = |position = [[Far-left politics|Far-left]] |alliance = |symbol = |website = |country = Kyrgyzstan }} The '''Communist Party of Kyrgyzstan''' ({{lang-ru|link=no|Коммунистическая Партия Киргизстана}} ''Kommunisticheskaya Partiya Kirgizstana'') is a political party in [[Kyrgyzstan]]. KPK was founded on 21 August 1999, following a split in the [[Party of Communists of Kyrgyzstan]]. {{Communist Parties|expanded=Asia}} KPK did not participate in the 2000 parliamentary elections. KPK publishes ''Kommunisty Kyrgyzstana''. The party is affiliated to the [[Communist Party of the Soviet Union (Shenin)|Communist Party of the Soviet Union]] of [[Oleg Shenin]].<ref>[http://www.broadleft.org/kg.htm Leftist Parties of Kyrgyzstan<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> ==References== {{reflist}} {{Kyrgyzstani political parties}} [[Category:Anti-Revisionist organizations|Kyrgyzstan]] [[Category:Communism in Kyrgyzstan]] [[Category:Communist parties in the Former Soviet Union]] [[Category:Political parties in Kyrgyzstan]] [[Category:Communist parties in Asia |Kyrgyzstan]] {{CP-stub}} {{Kyrgyzstan-party-stub}}
